question: Some people prefer the lifestyle and activities offered when living in a cold environment. Others prefer a hot environment. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
text: Geographical conditions are to affect people in various ways. Some individuals are more prone to integrate in cold regions, others can choose the warmer zones. Nonetheless, apart from seasonal features, these types of preferences of persons are connected to their psychological structures. In general, in the light of scientifical studies, while the introvert characters head toward cold climate conditions, extrovert ones select the hotter climate in relative.

As it is mentioned in the first paragraph, those who have the characteristic features which are in the limited connections with other individuals are to internalize the harsh wheater conditions such as windy, cold or snowy. The main reason for this situation is that the cold climate, up to a degree, blocks the social environment of people, such as the meeting or other events. Normally, it can be claimed that cold natural environment reflects the emotional fields of introverted people.

On the other side, if the sunny days and persons who would like to make various activities, especially in hot wheaters are compared to each other, it is overt that a strong correlation exists in terms of emotional ways. For example, vivid people in terms of social have the capability of setting a close relationship with another individuals. Because hot climates give a lot of opportunities to people. In other words, the open climates symbolize a more active lifestyle.

Eventually, the choices taken by people are rather various and they depend on different factors. The fundamental fact lies behind, as referred to the entrance of this text, is based on mental points of view and personal features or inborn traits.

error_list.error_des: The preposition in after the verb integrate may be incorrect. Consider changing it to another preposition.
It seems that there is an article usage problem here.
It seems that relationship may not agree in number with other words in this phrase.
The adjective another appears to be modifying the plural noun individuals. Consider replacing it with the adjective other.
It seems that preposition use may be incorrect here.
The word or doesn’t seem to fit this context. Consider replacing it with a different one.
